Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to recall the standard Procure-to-Pay (P2P) process. From general knowledge, a typical P2P process flows like this: 1. Create Purchase Requisition 2. Approve Purchase Requisition 3. Issue Purchase Order 4. Receive Goods 5. Vendor Invoice Received 6. Match Invoice to PO (Purchase Order) 7. Release Payment 8. Close Case This ensures that everything is in order: you don't order without approval, you don't pay without receiving goods and matching the invoice, etc.

This is problematic because you're paying without proper checks, which could lead to fraud or errors.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1003: - Create Purchase Requisition - Approve Purchase Requisition - Issue Purchase Order - Release Payment - Vendor Invoice Received (after Release Payment?) - Receive Goods (even later) - Match Invoice to PO - Close Case Here, Release Payment happens before Vendor Invoice Received and before Receive Goods. Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1004: - Create Purchase Requisition - Approve Purchase Requisition - Receive Goods (before Issue Purchase Order?) - Issue Purchase Order (after Receive Goods?) - Vendor Invoice Received - Match Invoice to PO - Release Payment - Close Case Receive Goods before Issue Purchase Order?
